description: Ornamental onion (Allium karataviense) is an amazing plant for many reasons. It is a hardy bulb from Central Asia with striking, star-shaped flowers in shades of purple and pink. Its leaves die back after flowering in midsummer and the flowers last until fall. It is perfect for a low-water garden as it is drought tolerant and prefers well-drained soil. It attracts butterflies and bees to the garden and can even be planted indoors for a stunning show of flowers. It also has beautiful, grass-like foliage and is an easy plant to care for - making it the perfect choice for a low-maintenance garden!
